website_summaries.verdict: These squeezable fat bomb snacks are perfect for an active, keto-on-the-go lifestyle.
pros: The 1-ounce package packs 210 calories and only 4g of total carbs, with protein from the nut butter
Delicious, portable, and no extra sweeteners
Some report a nice energy boost with consumption
cons: Several people report problems getting all the product out of the squeeze packets
They do separate, and must be kneaded before consuming for uniform consistency

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to love it......
customer_reviews.text: So I guess I am going to go against the grain here with all these glowing reviews. I thought it was just ok. Is it terrible? No. But I don't think it's amazing. First of all, it's very runny. (Yes, I kneaded the package first). I guess I thought it would be a thicker consistency like peanut butter or almond butter. It's not. Second, there are tiny bits of macadamia nut that you will never get to unless you cut the package open. They stay stuck at the bottom! The taste is just ok to me. So, I will finish the ones I bought, but I will not be re-ordering. I guess I'll just stick with whole macadamia nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Open/taped box and Gross
customer_reviews.text: The box was torn and taped back up. I have not had these before and am not sure what the texture is SUPPOSED to be like, but these are melted and liquidy. I saw other reviews that said they had to scrape the inside to get the stuff out, and one review that said the nut butter needed to be kneaded to eat. Well the box I got seems to be just liquid. The ingredients are macadamia nuts and sea salt, why so runny? Will NOT buy again.
customer_reviews.author: SF Green

customer_reviews.title: Sorry boys....didn't make the cut
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these fat bombs based upon a friends recommendation and a few reviews, however, the product didn't make muster. For the price, several scoops of sugar free peanut butter would suffice. I had hoped these would be like GU packs but all they are (realistically) is nut butter in a one ounce packet. I can but almond or some other nut butter for around $7.00 for a 10 oz. jar and scoop a tablespoon or so into a small container. Not impressed by this product. Sorry Charlie
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: I'm very disappointed in this product & even more disappointed there's NO ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed in this product & even more disappointed there's NO RETURN POLICY! This arrived in my mailbox in 97 degree weather in just a paper manilla envelope. Needless to say as I let it cool before I tried it, it had a moldy taste to it. These are expensive but I was willing to pay for them since I am a Keto Dieter and was looking forward to having these on hand. Just a bit frustrated! Had they arrived ice packed and FRESH maybe this review would be way different. Now I'm out the $25.00
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good contents, poor packaging and inferior value
customer_reviews.text: As another commenter noted, the actual usable amount is far less than listed, and even 100% was available, this is way overpriced for a teaspoon of nut butter with chocolate. Keep in mind nut butter experiences phase separation, so oil squirts out when you first open package. The remaining nut butter is so thick that it will take you multiple, frustrating squeeze attempts to get 80% of the remaining product out, leaving you 20% stuck unless you completely rip apart the package and lick off the remnants. This is very different than the goop I used for carbo loading during runs. You're far better off getting a container is almond butter from Costco and sugar free chocolate from Trader Joe's
customer_reviews.author: Muy Ben

customer_reviews.title: Packets are hard to use unless you cut them open ...
customer_reviews.text: Packets are hard to use unless you cut them open, scrape the oil out and then see if you have the patience to use it somehow.
customer_reviews.author: Anil Shankar

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: They are OK, but overpriced. 1 punch has 1oz. Make your own fat bomb.
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Runny oily no chocolate taste at all!!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly get a good recipe online make your own!! Seriously not what I thought they would be!! Runny poured out all over the place!! I think I’ll pass and make my own! Not at all what I thought it would be!! No chocolate taste at all!! Just oily runny nut butter!! Not at all appealing or appetizing. Passing on this one from now on!!
customer_reviews.author: Debra Mattosky

customer_reviews.title: Just buy the nuts and save yourself lots of money and frustration
customer_reviews.text: I heard about these on JRE so I had to try them....and I couldn’t be more disappointed. It’s literally just way-overpriced salted macadamia nuts mashed up in miserable-to-use packaging. I had to cut it open (picture) to get what wouldn’t come out when I squeezed. I had to scrape it off with my teeth because it was stuck to the sides of the packet. Considering how easy it is to just throw some nuts in a bag, I’ll never purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: End The Fed

customer_reviews.title: Purse Fatbombs!
customer_reviews.text: Newbie to Keto and needed portable fat bombs as I travel a lot for work! These are perfect! Filling! You do have to knead it for a good minute but it’s kinda relaxing to me- ha! I have them in my purse, in my desk drawer and at home! Thanks! Will be purchasing again!
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve D

customer_reviews.title: Worth the splurge
customer_reviews.text: I thought these would be weird and gross. I was wrong. They are great, "on-the-go," options for when you need to up your fat (Keto) and stave off hunger. After my first two packets, I got hooked. The texture was kind of odd at first, but I quickly realized it's very similar to almond butter with flax seed in it. I had one about every-other-day, and "sipped" right from the packet while I was busy and just needed to have something to hold me over. I think they are yummy, and they are in my rotation of Keto "splurges," for when I need to make my life easier without stressing out or ruining my macros.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Can’t get this stuff out of the packet. What a mess. Chunks of nuts. Nansty.
customer_reviews.author: M. Better

customer_reviews.title: good luck trying to eat the product
customer_reviews.text: the delivery system is awful, most of the product stasy in the bag, so you throw away most of it, if you good with that, I am not, its a mess to eat and get in your body, the contents are decent a little hard to swallow. I have to cut it out with scissors and still didnt get all of it. please get back to the drawing board.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Tasted almost rancid
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love it for a quick keto snack, but it tastes old and really gross. And I love most things with peanut butter! Perhaps I got a bad batch, but honestly it tasted almost rancid. Ate three over time (hoping it would improve), have thrown out the rest. Expensive mistake, sigh
customer_reviews.author: Richard Fitzmaurice

customer_reviews.title: Great for keto
customer_reviews.text: I keep a constant supply of these in my house. They taste great, are easy to take with you on the go, and provide a good source of fat if you're doing keto. Just make sure you knead the package before you open it. I usually massage the packet for a minute or two, making sure you push the bits from the corners around. If you don't take the time to knead it before opening it, then you're going to end up with a partial liquid/partial chunky product. Other than that required action, which I don't think is a big deal, the packets are perfect, and they have made keto much easier for me to follow successfully.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: These are high fat, low, protein and only 1 net carb. Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh these are delicious! I literally opened the entire package so I could eat every bit of it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Hambrick

customer_reviews.title: Expensive But Great Keto Option During Travel
customer_reviews.text: At $2.50 a pop, these packets are ridiculously expensive. I have no problem giving a lower rating for the absurd costs they charge. Unfortunately, traveling for work AND sticking to keto requires purchasing products like this. The taste is good, macros great, and very convenient for travel. I just hope in the near future they fix their production costs and lower the price...
customer_reviews.author: ChiTown

customer_reviews.title: I love them both but especially the chocolates one
customer_reviews.text: I can’t tell if I’m reviewing the regular or the chocolate tone. Anyway, I love them both but especially the chocolates one. I keep them in my desk drawer at work for an afternoon pick me up. I lean over my desk bc I can totally imaging dripping this down my front. When done, I tear or cut it apart to get every last bit otherwise I feel I’m leaving $on the table bc they are kind of expensive. I have reordered since they are so convenient, tasty, and healthy!
customer_reviews.author: K. Lavy

customer_reviews.title: Just Okay
customer_reviews.text: I like this product because I am unable to eat most other types of nuts and this is the only pecan and macadamia nut butter I’ve found. The product is quite runny, and the texture is inconsistent in general. The “meatier” butter seems to be stuck at the bottom and In the corners of the packet making it hard to get out. The top portion is runny. You really need a spoon to be able to get it all out. The taste is just okay.
customer_reviews.author: AuntieB

customer_reviews.title: overpriced
customer_reviews.text: these are great, but unfortunately a bit overpriced for what you get. You can buy a jar of mac butter and sprinkle some salt, mixed with cacao for a similar deal. The packets are also difficulty to tend with, better if frozen as you can push the butter out easily.
customer_reviews.author: stardust23

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: If you're NSNG or Keto or Low Carb or whatever then this is what you've been looking for to replace all those gooey gels you use to bring on your long rides or runs. Convenient packaging for carrying while on your long sporting endeavor, with great taste to go with it. And it's a small family owned business serving a small but passionate niche of sports going people. The only gripe I have is that since nut butters inherently separate the oil out while in packaging, it would be better if the opening was larger so that it was easier to squeeze out the nutty parts without first spilling the oil all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: BS AZ

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love FBomb...
customer_reviews.text: ...but it has some problems. Pro: It's nutrition profile is just what I'm looking for, for fat adapted running. Cons: (1) Packaging - (a) as compared with similar products is an awkward size and shape (b) The sharp edges have cut me twice already (corner of my mouth - Ouch!). (2) Contents - the contents are not thoroughly ground up. This contributes to difficulty in getting more than @ 7/10's, at best, of the contents out of the package. I'm still looking.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Shelly-Moody

customer_reviews.title: I like the concept of carrying fat bombs with me
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept of carrying fat bombs with me. However, I do not like the taste of this. There's no chocolate flavor and it is gritty. I think there are better nut butters out there.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Not Keto Friendly
customer_reviews.text: First off, these aren’t keto friendly. The company needs to take this off of their packaging. Cane sugar isn’t a Keto sugar. Keto is to pull yourself off of all refined sugars. Secondly, the flavor isn’t anything explosive. Yes it’s high in fat which is great but the sugar defeats the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Lissanln25

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!
customer_reviews.text: I am always trying to find new snacks for my diet and this is delicious! Definitely high in fat hence being called a FBOMB (Fat Bomb) but this is desirable if you are on a diet that calls for it. Don't hate on the product if you are not wanting fat in your diet. I wanted to try this product out because I always get cravings for chocolate and its hard finding low sugar chocolate for my diet. This fits the bill! Good source of fat while being delicious and portable. Definitely would buy again but only wish it was cheaper xD.
customer_reviews.author: RanBigBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product great taste!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. The flavor is great I got the variety pack and all the flavors completely delicious. These are affordable too if you’ve ever went and bought macadamia nuts they can get expensive. I took one star off on presentation the fat ratio is so great that the product is a bit runny the way the tops of these pouches are made to tear you end up with to big an opening which on my first one made it messy. Reordered already thanks for the great product. I recommend the rest of FBombs products as well I have had most of them and they are all great.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Higdon

customer_reviews.title: Eat Your Fat!
customer_reviews.text: I normally am not one compelled to write reviews, but this one is worth the time. This Fat Bomb is a Ketoers best friend: it’s easy to take on the go, easy to open, delicious, and keeps me full for a while. Yes, it’s pricy, but I’d rather have a delicious fat bomb where I don’t have to make it - and I can track my macros easily. Also, I love that the package had a thank you note for purchasing, which was a cute surprise! 10/10 buying it again.
customer_reviews.author: Apollonia

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!
customer_reviews.text: While these are pretty pricey, they are DELICIOUS! I keep them in the fridge because they are less runny that way. And I did discover that if I cut the packet open (3 sides) after I've squeezed out the nut butter, there is still a lot left on the inside of the pouch that I scrape off and eat. If these were less expensive, I'd get them a lot more often. I wish they offered this in a jar, but then I'd have a hard time stopping myself from eating it all! :)
customer_reviews.author: Energy Coach

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Keto snack
customer_reviews.text: These F Bombs are delicious and filling. Great for a high healthy fat Keto snack. It takes a little time to get used to eating something directly out of its package, if this isn't something you are used to. I like to roll mine from the bottom to get all the good stuff. Coconut/Macadamia is my favorite but also the most gooey. Mix it up well before opening!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie D

customer_reviews.title: Most expensive bland “peanut butter”.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing about this product was worth it. I feel stupid that I just bought a fancy little envelope of bland peanut butter. It provides nothing but extra space in your wallet where money used to be. I sure wish I had thought of the idea to repackage some flavorless nut butter and sell it for 100x was it’s worth. Do yourself a favor and make yourself an almond butter sandwich and save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Best flavor
customer_reviews.text: The flavor is excellent. The problem is getting product out of the packet into my mouth. I discovered the package needed to be cut down the side and opened up to get all the goodness out. Licking package is not something you want to do in your car or around other people. My advice...buy a jar and mix your own macadamia butter, cocoa, salt, Buy some little containers at dollar store or Amazon and plastic spoons.
customer_reviews.author: Chiane C

customer_reviews.title: Amazing taste, worth it
customer_reviews.text: I was apprehensive because of the price BUT THE ARE AWEOSME! They taste amazing and have sea salt. You get the polyunsaturated from the macadamias and the saturated fats from the coconut, a beautiful balance. The packets look bigger in person, and are filled with macadamia/coconut butter. I was going to use them mainly on the go but the flavor gave me ideas. I’m planning on using them on the go as a meal but also I want to put it in hot cocoa, coffee, homemade fat bombs, vegan yogurt, oatmeal, smoothies, and drizzled on brownies and nice cream. If they sold this in a jar I would so buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Lily S.

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose and tastes good
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to take with you for a quick snack or pick me up. It opens easily and you squeeze it in your mouth. I found it was mostly like peanut butter, not much chocolate and I definitely needed water in between. But if you are like me and have a sweet tooth and trying to follow Keto or a healthy diet, one of these is going to keep you from that chocolate cake or ice cream (or both). It did for me.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara H.

customer_reviews.title: Too runny
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stuff to use backpacking. Its extremely high caloric density is a big selling point. Basically 200-215 calories per 1 oz pack. As the package suggested I kneaded it extensively before opening, but it still runs out of the pack, a consistency similar to melted butter. If you put it on a cracker, it will drip trough the holes on the cracker. Now the upside is that you can more easily squeeze it out of the package, straight into your mouth.
customer_reviews.author: MJW

customer_reviews.title: Tastes Great But Too Runny
customer_reviews.text: These taste great, but are just too runny. If they were as thick as normal nut butter, for example Justins' Classic Almond Butter, they would be fabulous. But, no matter how diligently you knead them, they dribble out in the consistency of molasses and are really difficult to eat without making a mess. I tried kneading them first and then putting them in the fridge to harden up a bit and that worked okay, but the whole point of these is that you're supposed to be able to throw them in your briefcase or backpack or purse for an easy on-the-go snack -- so refrigeration isn't practical. I won't be re-ordering until they can figure out their consistency problem.
customer_reviews.author: SF Parent

customer_reviews.title: Received wrong flavor.
customer_reviews.text: So I really like these. I would’ve given 5 stars but I ordered the salted chocolate macadamia and I received the regular sea salt. Which I’m sure is still delish but I really wanted the chocolate. As you can see in the picture it is labeled wrong on the barcode. I guess I’ll just have to order some more.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin R.

customer_reviews.title: This is my new dessert!
customer_reviews.text: BEST KETO SNACK ON THE PLANET!!! Taste is insanely good! I bring these on hikes with me and use them to give me quick energy. I even use them as a treat or dessert when people around me are enjoying normal desserts! High fat and low carbs- great snack and packagable. The only fallback- it’s hard to get the last little bit from the package. I normally open it and use a spoon.
customer_reviews.author: M&S

customer_reviews.title: Fanatic Flavor, but Rather Expensive
customer_reviews.text: These Fbomb nut butters are quite good; however, they are also very expensive - this is the reason for 4 stars and not 5. I wish they were slightly more economical because then I would purchase them on a regular basis. For now, it will just be an intermediate thing. For anyone considering purchasing these, I would go ahead and give them a try. They are a great snack on the go, especially for those on the keto diet.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Gross
customer_reviews.text: Disgusting!!! I’ve been on keto for almost 2 years and thought these would be easy to carry around for a quick fat fix. Unfortunately, most the oil separates from the rest of the ingredients and unless you really spend time trying to mix it up prior to opening, you will get a mouth full of oil. If you do get it nice and mixed up, it tastes terrible!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Not a big fan of this slimy oily paste
customer_reviews.text: Yea, It's eatable but barley. Oil separates and you get a mouthful before you get to the dry buttery part. I'll stick to other snacks for my Keto Diet. They call it F Bomb because you will drop a few when you wonder why you bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Fat Chicken

customer_reviews.title: ENERGY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I put one of these down about 45 minutes before my WOD and the energy boost is awesome! Best part is I don't get the jitters and elevated heart rate from the caffeine laces products. When I use Bucked Up my heart is racing before I even start the WOD. As far as flavor goes. I like it, not overly chocolate but just enough. PRO TIP: make sure you squish the package around good before you open it or the 1st thing you get out of it is the MCT oil. Squish it up and it is a great supplement.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie M

customer_reviews.title: Good for hikes!
customer_reviews.text: these are good for hiking. They do have a small amount of cane sugar from the chocolate, but not enough to do anything significant.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Hajost

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, bad delivery system.
customer_reviews.text: Macadamia's are a staple in my climbing and mountaineering adventures. I'm fat adaptive and can climb a mountain on just a handful. I decided to give these a whirl. Tastes great, very portable, but just doesn't provide enough product to meet my personal dietary requirements. I get more bang from buying 1lb locally with 0 left over product. In addition, the flashy packaging is non-recyclable and just not environmentally conscious. As another mentioned, "just buy the nuts".
customer_reviews.author: lilmtnwolf

customer_reviews.title: Not a good taste for me
customer_reviews.text: While there is nothing at all wrong with this product, I personally can’t handle the taste. It might be ok if it were mixed into a smoothie or something, but even the smell is nauseating to me. I’m sure there are people who love this, but again, it’s just not for me. And it’s rather expensive for a product I don’t like.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa - Louisville, KY

customer_reviews.title: To Much Prep Time
customer_reviews.text: These taste good. The reason for the two star review is the nut butter settles to the bottom of the package becoming to dense to squeeze out of the package while the liquids come to the top. So you have to spend way to much time kneading it in order for it to combine int a smoothie paste so you can squeeze it out. Defeats the purpose of a quick snack.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Depraida

customer_reviews.title: Perfect energy bombs
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect little power bombs. I was happy to find this multipack. Comes in an unexpected zipper case, too. Perfect for energy on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Actually an accident.  Thought it was something different!
customer_reviews.text: I certainly didn’t read this well enough. I thought I was getting little Mini snacks of chocolate covered Macadamias as I hurried to find a 5th item for subscribe & save for the larger discount. I’m finding creative ways to use it, and it’s okay. Just not what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Just get a tablespoon of crisco
customer_reviews.text: On Keto....and I can eat any cardboard tasting protein bar....but this? This just tasted like a couple of tablespoons of Crisco. :-( Was definitely not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Information4Ewe

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for on the go hiking and biking activities! Just make sure you mix it real good before you decide to suck it down. We also get Fat Snax cookies and High Key Keto mini chocolate chip cookies and this is a yummy addition to those snacks! You can put it right on a Fat Snax chocolate chocolate chip cookie and it tastes similar to Reeses. Customer suggestion: We hope they come out with a cashew option and we also hope they come out with raw nut butter instead of roasted, as the fats do change when roasted, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Malia Burcham

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely delicious!
customer_reviews.text: We are going on a trip overseas, so I bought these as a healthy (fat bomb) snack to take along. I had one yesterday (before the trip) to make sure they were worth bringing along. OMW! They are delicious! Frankly, I wish they weren't quite so expensive, but we'll savor them as an extra special treat. Delicious, nutritious! Such a good thing to have along with us. Will definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Linda York

customer_reviews.title: Easily transportable keto-friendly running fuel
customer_reviews.text: I've recently switched to a HFLC diet and my previous running fuel would not work. My trainer suggested trying F-bombs to keep me in my burning zone, but still give me fuel. They fit right in my running belt, tear easily. I did NOT have trouble getting product out of the package, though, after sitting against my body, the contents were warm and I was able to squeeze them out. Plus, it tastes DELICIOUS. I do have to take fluids with to wash it down, but no big deal. Definitely will be ordering more.
customer_reviews.author: Briana S.

customer_reviews.title: not for me
customer_reviews.text: it wasn't c!ear immediately what this was - it's an energy shot like I've seen runners use, a slimy snack for quick energy. Taste is ok, but it is difficult to get into. Very oily. What i did was put it in the freezer a bit. It still came out oily, and you need scissors to get into it pretty much. I wouldn't recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Dango

customer_reviews.title: Tastes Awful!!
customer_reviews.text: The package came completely shredded and had clearly been opened. It was late shipping too. The taste is awful. Like drinking straight oil 😡. There is no chocolate taste whatsoever. Don’t waste your time
customer_reviews.author: K. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I opened the package and got a mouth full of oil. All the actual nut butter was hard as a rock and would not come out. Unless its 100 degrees outside allowing the nut butter to be liquid and mix well with the oil, then this is impossible to eat as is. Thanks Joe
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: YUMALICIOUS!
customer_reviews.text: These are a perfect grab and go snack...they can get me through to my next meal without a slump! Perfect source or healthy fat to give me that boost without a crash! and holy CRAP do they taste good...I love all the flavors however my favorite is chocolate..for obvious reasons! <3
customer_reviews.author: Val Kellogg

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: No chemical after taste. Very thin, saucy consistency. Nice sweet treat on the go without carb worries. Package opens easily, I haven't made a mess yet. I keep one in my car. Have one or two a week, usually at meetings when everyone else is having bagels or muffins.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So gross
customer_reviews.text: This is horrible. I opened it and it’s just oil and nasty. I get that some oil in a butter is expected but this isn’t even close to a consistency that’s edible. Its just pure runny gross liquid. I live where it’s really hot so maybe it melted I don’t know
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: They’re not what I expected. They’re runny even when kneaded well. Unlike other nut butters these are chunky and that doesn’t allow the product to all come out so you’re throwing away what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: HROD

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor but that price
customer_reviews.text: These are very good, perfect for when you need that little bump in fat for the day. The price is so high though. I know it's good ingredients so I can't complain too much. I would order again but I use them sparingly when I don't have any homemade fat bombs left or we're on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Patrice Markham

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great flavor. Great ingredients.
customer_reviews.text: I like the ingredients, I like that there's no added sugar. The taste is ok. You really need to like those flavors to enjoy it. I still have most of the box because I'm not tempted to eat them. I'll save them for when I need a snack on the go. I don't love the texture either but it's a bit butter. Sometimes I put them in my hot cocoa, I like that better.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Creamy perfection
customer_reviews.text: These things are so freaking good. I've tried to eat these quietly but its impossible. Every time i squeeze one of these fatty rich morsels in my mouth i make that food orgasm sound. My only reservations with these nutty treats from heaven is that they are really pricy. $2.50 for a small snack is rich people food.
customer_reviews.author: etownninja

customer_reviews.title: Looking forward to trying other flavors
customer_reviews.text: They are pretty good but make sure to mix up well or you could get a mouth full of oil when you first open. Not as sweet as I had hoped but they are still tasty I think once mixed properly
customer_reviews.author: A. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Disliked, i thought these were snacks, i was wrong, its basically a little fancy sac of oily nut butter. Waste of money, you could stick a spoon in a jar of peanut butter!
customer_reviews.author: robin s shinn

customer_reviews.title: Runny texture
customer_reviews.text: These barely had any flavor and the texture never quite got to a smooth consistency - just oil and some chunks of coconut meat. Even kneading the entire package under a blow dryer on high didn’t help it to blend. Invest your money in SuperFats instead - great consistency, even when kept in the fridge, and a very nutty flavor!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Vesper

customer_reviews.title: Best nut butter
customer_reviews.text: Love that these don't clump at the bottom. I used to buy Super Fat nut butters but they always became clumped up and hard at the bottom of the package. This product is more liquid. Great for a quick snack or putting in a protein shake.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: A keto essential
customer_reviews.text: Fbomb Is the bomb! This company makes many quality products that are essential to a keto lifestyle. They are convenient and portable and delicious. They are a little pricey but I think that it is worth the money
customer_reviews.author: St. James

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a good snack
customer_reviews.text: While i think the cane syrup could and should be an avoidable ingredient, I really like the taste of these. My issue is the sheer strength and time I have to put into getting the thicker stuff out of the bottom so I can actually eat it. It also cuts the sides of my mouth far too easily. Fan of the flavor, but not really of the packaging or functionality at all
customer_reviews.author: Caryn Borland

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Macros
customer_reviews.text: I am very mixed on this item. Pros: Macros are fantastic Easy on the go snack Easy storage Cons: Expensive for just peanut butter and oil Very watery Not too much flavor You cant beat the macros, easy on the go snack that tastes good but it is an expensive item for essentially a fat bomb
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: So yummy!
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost, these are delicious. If it came in a jar I would eat it with a giant spoon. Lucky for me it doesn't. I love the portability of the portioned packets. I have used them for an energy boost during marathons as well as for a mid-day pick me up at work. Did I mention they are so tasty? I literally peel the packet all the way open so I can get every last speck.
customer_reviews.author: Marathon_gal

customer_reviews.title: Used on a thru hike.
customer_reviews.text: These packs were very convenient to pull out and eat while I was hiking on the Appalachian Trail. Make sure you press on the package to mix up the ingredients well. Some of the oils needed stirred back in. Flavor was good.
customer_reviews.author: Billy E Somers

customer_reviews.title: Great taste!
customer_reviews.text: I really do like this product! It taste great and gave me a boost when I needed it. What I don’t like is the packaging. I wish there was a different way of packaging because it’s hard to get 100% of the product out
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Yummmmm
customer_reviews.text: So much yes! Perfect for paleo, Primal, higher fat and Keto diets. And tastes amazing! It has a very thin consistency in warmer climates. I also get sad when I can’t get some of the thicker macadamia pirates out of the packet lol... other than that it’s so dang good :)
customer_reviews.author: V Roze

customer_reviews.title: Great Keto snack
customer_reviews.text: Filling, easy to travel with, and I love the taste of this flavor. My only complaint is how the packet is designed when it comes to actually eating them. If you just tear it straight across it's sharp on your lips. I figured out a better way but that part can def be improved. Overall glad I tried these. Have already re-ordered more a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Somewhere in between a treat or a snack...
customer_reviews.text: This doesn’t seem to do the trick for me. It’s almost like eating peanut butter but somehow wasn’t sweet enough to be a treat or textured enough to be a real snack. Maybe bike riders would liken this similar to gel packs on rides, at least that’s what it reminds me of. However, if you mix in a little monk fruit maybe it can be a fat bomb dessert if craving something sweet?
customer_reviews.author: N.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I first heard about these things on Joe Rogan's show (interview with Alex Honnold). I researched the product and saw enough good reviews and star rating on Amazon I decided to try them. Although a little pricey, these snacks are awesome. I had been looking for some high fat snack like this and these are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Keith B.

customer_reviews.title: I want to like this. It's clean and the taste is fine
customer_reviews.text: I want to like this. It's clean and the taste is fine, but he packaging really undermines an otherwise good product. The oils from the butter separate to the top, and the pieces of nut and salt settles to the bottom and no mater how much you squish the contents around to reconstitute them before opening, you won't be able to. The punch will sprout a leak otherwise. The only way to get to the good stuff at the bottom is cut the package open and scrape them out making the whole thing anything BUT convenient.
customer_reviews.author: vanessa samora

customer_reviews.title: Really good!
customer_reviews.text: I have been on a Keto diet for several months and this stuff is a life saver! Love it so much. It taste great!
customer_reviews.author: Drew S.

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but good
customer_reviews.text: The taste took a little getting used to for me, but I've really grown to like it. It's pretty pricey for the amount you get, but I throw these in my purse for a little pick-me-up whenever I need one and it does the trick. My only real gripe other than price is that the pieces of macadamia nut get stuck at the bottom of the packet so unless you rip the whole thing open and really get in there, you'll never get it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: oil seperates must be kneaded first before opening then still hard to get it all out
customer_reviews.text: oil seperates must be kneaded first before opening then still hard to get it all out and hard to put opening in your mouth upside down and squeeze out also you can only eat one a day as the trans fat is 50% unless you eat nothing else but two of these a day
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Give it time. Its great.......
customer_reviews.text: To be completely honest the first time I tried this i was like, nope. It was strange to me. Anyways after a few months on the keto diet I live for this stuff. It's one of my favorite treats to eat. Taste great, makes me feel satisfied.... I order 2 boxes a month. I wish they would come down on the price so I could buy more.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: These taste awesome- they are a fantastic treat!
customer_reviews.text: These taste great, a little pricey, but cheaper than in a store. If you are paleo or keto these are delicious and hit the spot when you need a treat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer - Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great keto energy when out and about
customer_reviews.text: Aside from the name, with which we’ve had a bit of fun, this is a great product to use when spending time outdoors. Whether camping, hiking, biking , hunting...whatever, it’s easy to throw a few in a pack and take off. They taste quite good, and provide a nice smooth energy. You don’t get jacked like with like sugar and caffeine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yummy
customer_reviews.text: You really have to slap them around a bit and massage them to get them to mix up otherwise they’ll leak out the oil and leave the chocolate and nut butter. Aside from that, they are very good and hit the sweet spot. It’s kinda fun to beat them up, anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Justin and Elaina Blanton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent like usual.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these at our GNC before, but since the nearest one is 45 minutes out, we decided to buy them off of amazon. These ones were perfectly mixed (ones in store were the crushed nuts at the bottom and oil at top), but these were amazing! Box came perfect- no crush or anything.
customer_reviews.author: corpusbonds

customer_reviews.title: Very little actual nut butter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I wanted a convenient way to carry nutrition for hiking, running etc. This product is all hype and packaging. There was such a small amount of actual nut butter in the packet that I had to cut the packet open to scrape it out. Then I had oil from the nut butter dripping all over the place. there are other, better and better priced alternatives. I rarely write reviews but this was such a rip off that I felt compelled to voice my review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Macadamia nut and coconut flavor - butters are NOT mixed together
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the macadamia nut with coconut butter. The package was ruined upon delivery - but whatever. The nut butter itself was NOT what I expected. The coconut butter so solidify on the sides and bottom with the macadamia nut butter being totally liquid. Wouldn’t be able to “knead” the packet though to incorporate the two butters together. Won’t be buying it again. Would actually like my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Good Product...Bad Package
customer_reviews.text: The product itself was delicious. I just wish I didn't have to fight to get it all out of the package. The challenge comes from the chucks of nuts. You need the handle of a fork or knife to get all the bits of macadamia up to the neck and out. Otherwise you are leaving a good deal of product in the pouch.
customer_reviews.author: K.R.

customer_reviews.title: FBOMB is the bomb!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently completed a 30 mile obstacle course through the rolling hills of Los Olivos. After 30 miles of trail running and 69 obstacles later, FBOMB was my primary fuel source and it was easy to digest and enjoy!!
customer_reviews.author: Coach

customer_reviews.title: Great for on the go!
customer_reviews.text: I have my packets in my car, backpack, office snack stash...and some at home. They're great for keeping me on the kept track and are really good tasting. My 2 issues are: the packets are a bit too wide for my mouth (when eating from the packet, of course), so they tend to cut the corners; also, when temps rise, they oil melts, so they can be tricky to eat/tend to ooze out once opened...eat right away.
customer_reviews.author: Lori M. Ouellette

customer_reviews.title: Great taste, but pricey
customer_reviews.text: I'm always looking for quick little snacks to help keep me on the Keto diet. I keep one of these in my purse in case I'm in a bind and need something to get me by until I can find or prepare a Keto friendly meal. This is very tasty and I would order it more often if it wasn't so expensive for each little pack.
customer_reviews.author: unamas

customer_reviews.title: Tastes Amazing - Packaging Kinda Sucks -
customer_reviews.text: Other than having to rip it open and get the goods out, product tastes amazing. Love it. Gotta find a better way to be able to get it all out though.. however, I do not have a solution! Maybe like the squeezable applesauce packets? Messy if you have a mustache.. 👨
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Anderson

customer_reviews.title: These are great when you are on the go!!
customer_reviews.text: I keep one in my purse for when I need a quick snack, or I'm out and about and my food choices are limited. Highly recommend! The flavor is great and it fills me up.
customer_reviews.author: Babs360

customer_reviews.title: Finally...NO Almonds nut butter!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE nut butters, but can not have almonds. Finally someone makes one that doesn't have them!! LOVE these babies for travel and having handy in my purse. Perfect KETO snack!! Thank you for leaving out the almonds :)
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and tasty
customer_reviews.text: Nice consistency with the mac nut base, especially after being in a warm pocket during winter hikes and kneading as recommended. The size is perfect for a quick shot of fat and flavor, while avoiding inevitable head-down into a jar of nut butter, underestimating how many "tablespoons" did I just eat.
customer_reviews.author: JB in VA

customer_reviews.title: Yum
customer_reviews.text: Have to really squish it for awhile so the oils don't squirt out.
customer_reviews.author: Just me

customer_reviews.title: Tasty snack
customer_reviews.text: This is a tasty and healthy snack that will keep you on track with Keto. Wish the packaging were a little different. Hard to get every bit out of the package.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Horrible packaging
customer_reviews.text: The product is good, but the packaging doesn't work. You open one end and try to squeeze it out, but most of the butter won't come out. Sometimes only the oily part squirts out. I have to get a knife and cut it open so I can get to the buttery part. Just put it on glass jars please.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Keto Runner Review!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I was looking for something to take on runs since I'm a keto runner it can be difficult to find fuel for my long runs. Most long run gels and gummies out there are not keto friendly. But I've finally found my fuel !! It also fits in my running belt or on the thigh pockets of my leggings! Super excited. The only thing some what negative is i have to chase it with water due to the texture but not a big deal. Will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not-so-lovely bunch of coconuts!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I feel like I have a good understanding of what Tom Hanks’ character on Castaway experienced with his island diet...this straight up tasted like I was eating raw coconut...liquid, greasy coconut. It was absolutely disgusting! Not even the slightest hint of macadamia in there. I definitely do not recommend this flavor, but at $25 a pop, I’m not up for any further experimenting after this experience!
customer_reviews.author: Charles N. Perdomo

customer_reviews.title: Yummy perfect snack
customer_reviews.text: I love these. For those saying they’re hard to eat, knead them more. I promise when they’re mixed we’ll it’s easy. And just roll up the package like you do with toothpaste as you eat it.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

product_meta.title: FBOMB Macadamia Nut Butter Packets: Salted Chocolate (10 Pack), Keto Fat Bombs: All-Natural Energy From Healthy Fats | Low Carb, Paleo, Keto Snacks With No Added Sugar
feature_bullets: HIGH QUALITY FAT BOMBS: It’s what we do best! Nut Butters are one of the best high-fat snacks you can find. We make them using a proprietary cool-grind process that produces a creamy base texture with a few small nut chunks. We believe this unique texture provides the ultimate nut butter experience!

NATURAL ENERGY: Macadamia nuts are known for their high-quality fat profile, with a very pleasant and mild taste. It’s the highest density energy source of its kind and is superior to most of the energy shots and bars out there.

ON-THE-GO SNACK: Durable and portable, our nut butter packets are perfect for hiking the Grand Canyon, a mid-day meal replacement, or a snack on-the-go! Knead the packet to mix it up, tear off the top, and enjoy the smooth, creamy, and tasty power of fat-based energy wherever you are.

PALEO AND KETO: Made from an all-natural blend of Macadamia Nut Butter, organic fair-trade dark chocolate, and a touch of sea salt crystals, these fat bombs aren’t only unbelievably delicious but perfect paleo and keto snacks.

DROP FBOMBS LIKE A PRO: Whether you’re a packet squeezer or a bottom-up pouch roller, you can enjoy these fat bombs anywhere you want. We recommend dropping FBOMBS with friends, while at work, the gym, on road trip, or out on a trail.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
